synthesis_method: The electrolyte synthesis process involves weighing lithium sulfide (Li2S) and phosphorus pentasulfide (P2S5) in a glove box under an argon atmosphere to achieve a specific molar ratio, mixing the powders in an agate mortar to obtain a raw material composition, which is then subjected to mechanical milling in a planetary ball mill for 40 hours to produce an amorphized sulfide solid electrolyte material.
